benchmark_details.name: LegalViz
benchmark_details.overview: LegalViz is a novel dataset for visualizing legal texts through diagram generation, providing 7,010 pairs of legal documents and visualizations across 23 languages, utilizing the DOT graph description language of Graphviz.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset for legal text visualization, facilitating the understanding of complex legal documents for non-experts through diagrams.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset may not perform equally across all 23 languages due to varying resource availability.

data.source: Legal documents sourced from the EUR-LEX website, including judgments, orders, and rules of EU countries.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by legal domain experts using the DOT language of Graphviz.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by comparing generated diagrams to reference diagrams using alignment and textual similarity measures.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment between generated visualizations and reference diagrams, reflecting the quality of both graph structure and legal content representation.
methodology.validation: Dataset was validated through empirical studies comparing few-shot and fine-tuned models on legal diagram generation.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset is based on publicly available EU legal materials, excluding personal or sensitive information.
